title.narrative: Physical Security and Stockpile Management (PSSM), Weapons and Ammunition Destruction and Weapons Marking in the DRC

description.narrative: This project represents a continuation of activities under grant 16-GR-1082 (above). This project aims to improve human security in the DRC; through the destruction of obsolete and surplus arms and ammunition; through improved management of storage facilities; through the fabrication and installation of SALW armories and through the marking of weapons. In order to accomplish this goal, MAG will continue to reduce the risks posed by unsecured ammunition storage facilities by implementing basic improvements to 25 storage facilities throughout the DRC; continue the development of long-term national capacity by training 93 FARDC and PNC personnel in PSSM practices and also by providing internationally-recognized EOD Level 3 tuition to a selected experienced member of MAG’s national staff; collect and destroy a further 150 US tons of obsolete and surplus ammunition and 8,800 weapons; and continue to reduce the risks of SALW diversion by fabricating 6 armories (containers).
